edu.vserver.exercises.model
Interface ExecutionState

All Superinterfaces:
java.io.Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
MutableExecutionState
public interface ExecutionState
extends java.io.Serializable

An implementor holds information about the current state of certain exercise. The class can be used to inform interested listeners that for example no submissions should be made at certain point of execution.

Author:
Riku Haavisto, Johannes Holvitie

Method Detail

isAllowReset

boolean isAllowReset()
Returns:
true if reset-button should be enabled in the current state

isAllowSubmit

boolean isAllowSubmit()
Returns:
true if submit-button be enabled in the current state

isResetShown

boolean isResetShown()
Returns:
true if reset-button should be shown in the current state

isSubmitShown

boolean isSubmitShown()
Returns:
true if submit-button should be shown in the current state

isMenuEnabled

boolean isMenuEnabled()
Returns:
true if the exercise menu should be enabled in the current state

hasUnsubmittedChanges

boolean hasUnsubmittedChanges()
Returns:
true if the user made changes to the exercise's state since last submit or the loading of the exercise
